main function is to declutter the springboard by removing all the notification badges (or not, this is an option in the settings panel) and place them in a one easy-to-get area, the "folder".

Here's how it works:

- Tap on the StatusBar icon to invoke thefolder to see what apps have notifications (red badge) and what apps that doesn’t have (white badge).

-on an app will delete its notifications quickly.

-on an app will invoke its notifications which you can open, delete or force touch.

-on thelet you delete all the notifications for the selected app or force touch to delete them all.

- Tapto show the selected app under(you can easily switch between multiple apps!).

There is also an option to show. These are in short mini notification badges (you can choose their shape too) that only show you that you have a notification, without the culture of numbering.

is set to “light” mode by default and there is an option to switch to the light side or let Confero choose which one is better.

option let the Confero Icon pulse when you get a notification.

can be hidden if there's not any notifications.
